recede.translation[0].definitions[0].def: if something you can see or hear recedes, it gets further and further away until it disappears
recede.translation[0].definitions[1].def: if a memory, feeling, or possibility recedes, it gradually goes away
recede.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The pain in his head gradually receded.
recede.translation[0].definitions[2].def: if water recedes, it moves back from an area that it was covering
recede.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: The flood waters finally began to recede in November.
recede.translation[0].definitions[3].def: if your hair recedes, you gradually lose the hair at the front of your head
recede.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: He was in his mid-forties, with a receding hairline.
recede.translation[1].definitions[0].def: if prices, interest rates etc recede, they decrease
recede.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Growth was expected to recede throughout the year.
